text: Beam and Boom
What Is Light?: Energy We Can See
We can see because of light.
There are many sources of light.
Light can be found in nature, like the sun.
The sun is the most important natural light source.
The sun allows us to see during the day.
The moon reflflects the sun’s light.
The moon allows us to see when it's dark.
People also make light, such as light bulbs.
Light bulbs help us see in darkness.
Light reflects off things.
The reflected light then enters our eyes.
Our brain figures out visual information.
Our eyes need light to work.
It means we see nothing in the lightless area.

We can see because of light.

Light can be found in nature, like the sun.
The sun is the most important natural light source.
The sun allows us to see during the day.

People also make light, such as light bulbs.
Light bulbs help us see in darkness.
Light reflects off things.
The reflected light then enters our eyes.
Our brain figures out visual information.
Our eyes need light to work.
It means we see nothing in the lightless area.
Beam and Boom!
What Is Sound?: Waves We Can Sense
Lovely music, a dog's barking, and a friend’s voice are all sounds.
Sound is anything we can hear.
For example, when a musician strums guitar strings, the strings vibrate.
Sound is created by vibrations.
These vibrations travel into our ears.
When something vibrates, it moves the air.
This movement travels in waves, like ocean waves.
Faster vibrations cause sounds with a higher pitch.
Stronger vibrations cause louder sounds.
Sound waves move through different materials.
Different materials make different sounds.
Sound can be too loud or quiet.
Some use hearing aids to hear better.
Sound waves are not visible but we sense them.

Beam and Boom!
The Darkness and Silence:Without Light and Sound
Imagine a lightless world.
Darkness appears in front of your eyes now.
First of all, everything would be invisible.
We couldn’t walk, read, exercise, or play.
Daily life wouldn’t be easy anymore.
Without light, plants would die.
Humans and animals would also disappear.
Music, laughter, or talking would disappear.
In a world without sound, talking would be uneasy.
We would be left speechless, using text more.
We wouldn’t hear alarms or sirens, putting us in danger.
Without both light and sound, life would be dangerous.
Thus light and sound are vital for our lives.
